programme.title: America In Color S2 - Playtime
programme.desc: At the start of the 20th century, Americans found themselves with more time and money on their hands. This is the story of America at play, presented through archival footage and home movies that have been digitally remastered and colourized.

programme.title: The Wine Show S3 - EP2
programme.desc: Matthew Goode & James Purefoy’s next road trip challenge takes them to the Douro Valley. Matthew Rhys and Joe enjoy Mexican food and wines in NYC. In Hungary, Joe Fattorini explores the health-giving stories.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP13
programme.desc: Lurking beneath the waters of the northwest is some of the best seafood in the country and in fact, the world. We meet the original custodians of the areas and we taste the food they helped them thrive in this region. Seattle’s seafood scene has grown into one of the best in the world.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP14
programme.desc: We kick off with a Greek restaurant that specialises in seafood. We go north up to Harlem to try a new eatery with a New York foodie and we try the delectable tastes of the world’s first fine-dining restaurant, all here in New York.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP15
programme.desc: Starting in Tampa, at Ulele, a rustic chic restaurant with native Floridian fare, is named after a Native American princess. We then head to Orlando where we experience a mouth watering meal at a plant-based deli cafe, Market On South.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP16
programme.desc: We visit Seattle to try a seafood restaurant with an amazing view of the city, then head to Portland to try some genuine Russian food, with a Portland legend. Then back to Seattle to sample some world cuisine.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Awarua
programme.desc: Ahi has now been open for over 18 months. Ben Bayly is keen to revisit some of the people who make up the Ahi menu, starting in Awarua.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Wallaby
programme.desc: Ben continues his South Island trip, visiting the Mackenzie Country, the Canterbury Plains and the Rakaia Gorge.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Spearfishing
programme.desc: Ben travels to the Marlborough Sounds where he goes spearfishing for Butterfish and checks out the Farmers Market before heading to Nelson to visit New Zealand’s oldest pub.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Bay Of Plenty
programme.desc: From Avocado, Truffles, Macadamia to Vanilla, the stunning Bay of Plenty is a growers paradise.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Whanganui
programme.desc: Ben is in Whanganui where he goes hunting with All Black legend Glenn Osborne before visiting Woodhaven Gardens.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Southland
programme.desc: This week, Ben is in Southland where he visits Granity Downs then tries to perfect the art of making Cheese Rolls.

programme.desc: From Buffalo Bill to the construction of the Hoover Dam, this is the story of America's Wild West in color.

programme.title: Take Us Home: Leeds United - El Loco
programme.desc: New Leeds United owner Andrea Radrizzani has a mission: To take Leeds United back to the Premier League. But first he must find a new head coach capable of fulfilling the clubs supporters dreams.

programme.title: Take Us Home: Leeds United - Fighting Spirit
programme.desc: Leeds United must overcome a mounting injury crisis and show fighting spirit to maintain their challenge for promotion. Fanatical Leeds fan Josh Warrington faces Carl Frampton for IBF World Title.

programme.title: Take Us Home: Leeds United - Fighting Spirit
programme.desc: Leeds United must overcome a mounting injury crisis and show fighting spirit to maintain their challenge for promotion. Fanatical Leeds fan Josh Warrington faces Carl Frampton for IBF World Title.

programme.title: Take Us Home: Leeds United - Spygate
programme.desc: As the transfer window opens Leeds target new signings as the club is rocked by one of the most controversial stories in world football.

programme.title: Hotel Chocolat - EP2
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Britain's largest independent chocolate maker. As the giant factory gears up for one of their busiest times of the year, co-owner Angus Thirlwell is hoping new ranges will entice customers back into stores.

programme.title: Seriously Amazing Objects S2 - Risk Takers
programme.desc: Discover objects used by some of history’s biggest risk-takers, including a daredevil spacesuit, a dress worn by a civil rights hero, and an artificial heart. Meet the trailblazers behind them and see the indelible mark they made on humankind.

programme.title: Seriously Amazing Objects S2 - Super Size
programme.desc: Join visitors for a behind-the-scenes tour of the Smithsonian’s super-sized objects. First, check out a 60-pound salamander, a 17-foot-long beard, and a fossilized 500-pound prehistoric sloth. Then learn how 22-foot-tall totem poles are carved.

programme.title: Baby Animals - Family Ties
programme.desc: The animal kingdom can be cold and unforgiving, but for baby baboons, penguins, capybaras, and emperor tamarins, having a helpful family makes life a little easier.

programme.title: Baby Animals - Raising Babies
programme.desc: Follow the staff at Parc Omega in Quebec, Canada, during the busy spring when moose, boars, raccoons, and visiting Canada Geese have their babies.

programme.title: Baby Animals S2 - Surrogate Families
programme.desc: Most animal babies rely on mom to show them how to succeed in the wild, but sometimes they need a helping hand. Meet a wombat, leopards, polar bears and a rare Australian quoll being raised by humans in surrogate families.

programme.title: Endangered Wildlife Sanctuary - EP1
programme.desc: Follow in the steps of the Fota-born bison deep in the Romanian forest and a handsome pair of Red Pandas as they prepare for life away from the Park.

programme.title: Endangered Wildlife Sanctuary - EP2
programme.desc: Focus on Fota Wildlife Park’s conservation work with some of our native species. Meet the newest cheetah cubs born in Cork and two critically endangered monkeys who make Fota their home.

programme.title: Endangered Wildlife Sanctuary - EP3
programme.desc: Meet three Asiatic lion cubs, the first to be born in Fota Wildlife Park and travel to Madagascar to observe some of the world’s most endangered lemurs in the wild.

programme.title: Endangered Wildlife Sanctuary - EP4
programme.desc: The Park’s Director Sean McKeown travels to Madagascar. Follow the journey of 2 month old Dharma and see her transform from needy cub to majestic adult.

programme.desc: For the younger generation, climate change will unquestionably carry a massive burden. Clinical Psychologist Dr Clare Kambamettu finds out the problem of climate change is as much psychological as it is technical and political.

programme.title: Beyonce & Jay-Z: Power Love
programme.desc: A merger of megastar music. Discover the true story of multi-genre performer and fashion promoter, Beyonce Knowles and the world's first hip hop billionaire, Jay-Z.

programme.title: Adele: A New Chapter
programme.desc: Adele is a 15-time Grammy Award-winning artist whose soulful sound has thrust her into the limelight. Through her own words, video and live performances, take an incredible look at the life and times of one of the greatest artists of all time.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP3
programme.desc: Curators Steph and Jenny plan a major new exhibition celebrating the work of innovative British fashion designer Mary Quant who shook up women’s fashion in the 1960s with clothing that liberated women from decades of corsetry.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP4
programme.desc: This week, we meet curators and conservators trying to preserve some of the finest examples of craftsmanship in the world.

programme.title: Stories From The Vaults - Top Secret
programme.desc: Join host Tom Cavanagh as he takes you behind the scenes to examine the treasures, secret symbols, and coded messages that you can find at the Smithsonian. With the help of curators and other experts, we unlock some of the Smithsonian's most compelling mysteries.

programme.title: Stories From The Vaults - Villains And Rogues
programme.desc: Join host Tom Cavanagh as we explore the crime "scene" at the Smithsonian's Vaults: photographic evidence from the Crime of the Century; everyone's favorite natural villain, the snake; and America's first "Lone Gunman": John Wilkes Booth.

programme.title: Stories From The Vaults - Famous Donors
programme.desc: What do John Steinbeck, Teddy Roosevelt and Phyllis Diller have in common? They have all donated items to the Smithsonian's massive collection. Join host Tom Cavanagh on a behind-the-scenes tour of the high-tech vaults of the Smithsonian!

programme.title: Stories From The Vaults - Superlatives
programme.desc: When you have more than 151 million objects in one place, from the microscopic to the gigantic, from the ancient to the modern, it takes something special to stand out from the rest. Go behind the scenes of the Smithsonian with host Tom Cavanagh.

programme.title: Take Us Home: Leeds United - El Loco
programme.desc: New Leeds United owner Andrea Radrizzani has a mission: To take Leeds United back to the Premier League. But first he must find a new head coach capable of fulfilling the clubs supporters dreams.

programme.title: Take Us Home: Leeds United - Fighting Spirit
programme.desc: Leeds United must overcome a mounting injury crisis and show fighting spirit to maintain their challenge for promotion. Fanatical Leeds fan Josh Warrington faces Carl Frampton for IBF World Title.

programme.title: Take Us Home: Leeds United - Spygate
programme.desc: As the transfer window opens Leeds target new signings as the club is rocked by one of the most controversial stories in world football.

programme.title: Hotel Chocolat - EP2
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Britain's largest independent chocolate maker. As the giant factory gears up for one of their busiest times of the year, co-owner Angus Thirlwell is hoping new ranges will entice customers back into stores.

programme.title: Seriously Amazing Objects S2 - Risk Takers
programme.desc: Discover objects used by some of history’s biggest risk-takers, including a daredevil spacesuit, a dress worn by a civil rights hero, and an artificial heart. Meet the trailblazers behind them and see the indelible mark they made on humankind.

programme.title: Seriously Amazing Objects S2 - Super Size
programme.desc: Join visitors for a behind-the-scenes tour of the Smithsonian’s super-sized objects. First, check out a 60-pound salamander, a 17-foot-long beard, and a fossilized 500-pound prehistoric sloth. Then learn how 22-foot-tall totem poles are carved.

programme.title: Baby Animals - Lil' Hunters
programme.desc: Life at the upper end of the food chain means hard work and constant learning. Discover how young predators, from lion and cheetah cubs to coyotes and silver fox kits, learn to move stealthily and harness their highly adapted skills.

programme.title: Baby Animals - Family Ties
programme.desc: The animal kingdom can be cold and unforgiving, but for baby baboons, penguins, capybaras, and emperor tamarins, having a helpful family makes life a little easier.

programme.title: Baby Animals - Raising Babies
programme.desc: Follow the staff at Parc Omega in Quebec, Canada, during the busy spring when moose, boars, raccoons, and visiting Canada Geese have their babies.

programme.title: Baby Animals S2 - Surrogate Families
programme.desc: Most animal babies rely on mom to show them how to succeed in the wild, but sometimes they need a helping hand. Meet a wombat, leopards, polar bears and a rare Australian quoll being raised by humans in surrogate families.

programme.title: Endangered Wildlife Sanctuary - EP1
programme.desc: Follow in the steps of the Fota-born bison deep in the Romanian forest and a handsome pair of Red Pandas as they prepare for life away from the Park.

programme.title: Endangered Wildlife Sanctuary - EP2
programme.desc: Focus on Fota Wildlife Park’s conservation work with some of our native species. Meet the newest cheetah cubs born in Cork and two critically endangered monkeys who make Fota their home.

programme.title: Endangered Wildlife Sanctuary - EP3
programme.desc: Meet three Asiatic lion cubs, the first to be born in Fota Wildlife Park and travel to Madagascar to observe some of the world’s most endangered lemurs in the wild.

programme.title: America In Color S2 - Wild West
programme.desc: From Buffalo Bill to the construction of the Hoover Dam, this is the story of America's Wild West in color.

programme.title: America In Color S2 - Playtime
programme.desc: At the start of the 20th century, Americans found themselves with more time and money on their hands. This is the story of America at play, presented through archival footage and home movies that have been digitally remastered and colourized.

programme.title: America In Color S2 - Playtime
programme.desc: At the start of the 20th century, Americans found themselves with more time and money on their hands. This is the story of America at play, presented through archival footage and home movies that have been digitally remastered and colourized.

programme.title: The Wine Show S3 - EP2
programme.desc: Matthew Goode & James Purefoy’s next road trip challenge takes them to the Douro Valley. Matthew Rhys and Joe enjoy Mexican food and wines in NYC. In Hungary, Joe Fattorini explores the health-giving stories.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP13
programme.desc: Lurking beneath the waters of the northwest is some of the best seafood in the country and in fact, the world. We meet the original custodians of the areas and we taste the food they helped them thrive in this region. Seattle’s seafood scene has grown into one of the best in the world.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP14
programme.desc: We kick off with a Greek restaurant that specialises in seafood. We go north up to Harlem to try a new eatery with a New York foodie and we try the delectable tastes of the world’s first fine-dining restaurant, all here in New York.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP15
programme.desc: Starting in Tampa, at Ulele, a rustic chic restaurant with native Floridian fare, is named after a Native American princess. We then head to Orlando where we experience a mouth watering meal at a plant-based deli cafe, Market On South.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP16
programme.desc: We visit Seattle to try a seafood restaurant with an amazing view of the city, then head to Portland to try some genuine Russian food, with a Portland legend. Then back to Seattle to sample some world cuisine.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Awarua
programme.desc: Ahi has now been open for over 18 months. Ben Bayly is keen to revisit some of the people who make up the Ahi menu, starting in Awarua.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Wallaby
programme.desc: Ben continues his South Island trip, visiting the Mackenzie Country, the Canterbury Plains and the Rakaia Gorge.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Spearfishing
programme.desc: Ben travels to the Marlborough Sounds where he goes spearfishing for Butterfish and checks out the Farmers Market before heading to Nelson to visit New Zealand’s oldest pub.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Bay Of Plenty
programme.desc: From Avocado, Truffles, Macadamia to Vanilla, the stunning Bay of Plenty is a growers paradise.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Whanganui
programme.desc: Ben is in Whanganui where he goes hunting with All Black legend Glenn Osborne before visiting Woodhaven Gardens.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S2 - Southland
programme.desc: This week, Ben is in Southland where he visits Granity Downs then tries to perfect the art of making Cheese Rolls.

programme.title: United Plates Of America - EP13
programme.desc: Lurking beneath the waters of the northwest is some of the best seafood in the country and in fact, the world. programme.title: America In Color S2 - Playtime
programme.desc: At the start of the 20th century, Americans found themselves with more time and money on their hands. This is the story of America at play, presented through archival footage and home movies that have been digitally remastered and colourized.

programme.title: America In Color S2 - American Royalty
programme.desc: Through rare archival footage and home movies, get a personal–and colourful–look into the lives of the wealthy and famous families of the 20th century, from the Roosevelts to the Rockefellers to the Vanderbilts.

programme.title: The Last Buffalo
programme.desc: The remarkable story of the near extinction and rescue of the American Bison through the eyes of William T Hornaday.

programme.title: Creatures Of The Lagoon
programme.desc: Marine biologists explore Florida’s Indian River Lagoon to discover the secrets of the many fascinating creatures that inhabit it.

programme.title: Into The Puma Triangle
programme.desc: Casey Anderson, a Montana native wildlife expert works with wildlife filmmaker René Araneda to capture the wild pumas of Torres del Paine National Park in Chilean Patagonia. Together, they have filmed things seen nowhere else in the world that will unlock the mystery of the puma’s true nature.

programme.title: Dogs: An Amazing Animal Family - Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: Meet the fastest, strongest and most unusual looking dogs on the planet. Biologist Patrick Aryee discovers how our human ancestors bred these traits from the dog’s wild wolf relatives.

programme.title: Dogs: An Amazing Animal Family - The Americas
programme.desc: Biologist Patrick Aryee travels to the Americas – the birthplace of the dog family. He meets super-furry snow foxes, gets face to face with a pack of wolves, and discovers the traits shared by all canines.

programme.title: Dogs: An Amazing Animal Family - Asia And Africa
programme.desc: Biologist Patrick Aryee follows the canine family’s evolutionary journey through Asia and Africa – where he meets acrobatic leaping foxes and bizarre egg-stealing raccoon dogs.

programme.title: America In Color S2 - Hollywood's Golden Age
programme.desc: Revisit the Golden Age of Hollywood, when actors became global celebrities and America became movie crazy. Using digitally remastered news footage and rare studio archives, see the dawn and meteoric rise of Tinseltown in full colour.

programme.title: Extraordinary Dogs - The Power In Movement Part 1
programme.desc: Italy's water resue dogs, New Zealand's search and rescue dogs and Australia's team of competitive Alaskan huskies.

programme.title: Extraordinary Dogs - The Mystery Of Healing Part 1
programme.desc: Max is a part of the "Cancer and Bio-detection Dogs" team. Napal is an assistance dog in the USA and Belgium's seizure alert dog, Maybe, sends alerts to his owner before an epileptic seizure.

programme.title: Extraordinary Dogs - Myth & Reality
programme.desc: Dogs in New Zealand can detect human emotions? A pet miniature Schnauzer can predict someone's death? How do dogs really communicate with each other?

programme.title: Extraordinary Dogs - Crucial Hearing
programme.desc: A Jack Russell Terrier barks when he ears the unique sound of a life threatening occurrence. How are dogs trained to provide assistance? Amos, trained by Hearing Dogs for Deaf People UK helps his owner through some difficult times.

programme.title: Extraordinary Dogs - Above And Beyond Loyal
programme.desc: Amy Rouse and her Border Collie Mist trains for the English National Sheepdog Trials. Quebec's MIRA foundation provides assistance dogs for children with autism. Buddy, a hero dog, guides an Alaskan State Trooper to his owner's workshop.

programme.title: Extraordinary Dogs - The Mystery Of Healing Part 2
programme.desc: Dogs and diabetes - how does it work? Whizz provides therapeutic benefits to children with special needs. Pups in Prison are trained by inmates over a period of 16 months.

programme.title: America In Color S3 - Coming To America
programme.desc: From Caribbean immigrants settling in Harlem to Italian “radicals” being shipped back home, explore America’s immigrant experience in the early 20th century as told through rarely-seen colourized footage.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP3
programme.desc: Curators Steph and Jenny plan a major new exhibition celebrating the work of innovative British fashion designer Mary Quant who shook up women’s fashion in the 1960s with clothing that liberated women from decades of corsetry.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP4
programme.desc: This week, we meet curators and conservators trying to preserve some of the finest examples of craftsmanship in the world.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP5
programme.desc: An unusual item has been spotted by curator Lucia – a vintage Louis Vuitton trunk, that came to the museum merely as container for a number of haute couture dresses. Lucia wants to unlock the trunk’s secrets.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP6
programme.desc: Catherine Sargent prepares a new exhibition devoted to cars. She must ensure they are displayed at their best. With the vehicles arriving on loan from around the world, it’s imperative that each one is kept without a scratch.

programme.title: 9/11: Stories In Fragments - EP1
programme.desc: Among the ruins of the buildings destroyed on 9/11, the everyday items and the ordinary citizens that discovered them share their stories of that unforgettable day.

programme.title: 9/11: The Heartland Tapes - EP1
programme.desc: The morning of September 11, 2001 began routinely but by 9:00 AM, the day's narrative had taken a tragic turn. This is an account of the tragedy as it unfolded, and as it aired in American cities large and small, told without narration or interviews.

programme.title: America In Color S2 - Hollywood's Golden Age
programme.desc: Revisit the Golden Age of Hollywood, when actors became global celebrities and America became movie crazy. Using digitally remastered news footage and rare studio archives, see the dawn and meteoric rise of Tinseltown in full colour.

programme.title: America In Color S3 - Coming To America
programme.desc: From Caribbean immigrants settling in Harlem to Italian “radicals” being shipped back home, explore America’s immigrant experience in the early 20th century as told through rarely-seen colourized footage.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP3
programme.desc: Curators Steph and Jenny plan a major new exhibition celebrating the work of innovative British fashion designer Mary Quant who shook up women’s fashion in the 1960s with clothing that liberated women from decades of corsetry.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP4
programme.desc: This week, we meet curators and conservators trying to preserve some of the finest examples of craftsmanship in the world.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP5
programme.desc: An unusual item has been spotted by curator Lucia – a vintage Louis Vuitton trunk, that came to the museum merely as container for a number of haute couture dresses. Lucia wants to unlock the trunk’s secrets.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum - EP6
programme.desc: Catherine Sargent prepares a new exhibition devoted to cars. She must ensure they are displayed at their best. With the vehicles arriving on loan from around the world, it’s imperative that each one is kept without a scratch.

programme.title: America In Color S3 - Coming To America
programme.desc: From Caribbean immigrants settling in Harlem to Italian “radicals” being shipped back home, explore America’s immigrant experience in the early 20th century as told through rarely-seen colourized footage.(n)

programme.title: America In Color S3 - Disasters
programme.desc: Witness historic disasters in vivid color. The Hindenburg crash, the San Francisco earthquake, the Galveston hurricane, and the tri-state tornado are a handful of calamities that slammed America and became crucial events that shaped the nation.(n)

programme.title: Eco Eye - A Place For Home
programme.desc: Duncan Stewart looks at the social implications of Ireland's extraordinary number of one-off homes across the countryside and searches for sustainable solutions to Ireland's housing problems.(n)

programme.title: Eco Eye - The Last Lake
programme.desc: Anja Murray investigates how one of the last remaining Marl lakes in Europe is facing decline. She hears from scientists concerned that pollution has pushed the lake to a tipping point.(n)

programme.title: Eco Eye - Radiation: The Silent Killer
programme.desc: Dr Clare Kambamettu explores radiation exposure in Ireland debunking some surprising myths she’ll uncover where the real danger lies and what we can do to protect ourselves.(n)

programme.title: Eco Eye - Cities Reimagined
programme.desc: Ireland’s population is expected to increase by more than 1 million people over the next 20 years, 75% of which will live in our cities. Can our cities handle this? Duncan Stewart investigates.(n)

programme.title: Eco Eye - Changing Nature
programme.desc: Anja explores our impact on the ocean and its inhabitants - from the sea's smallest component, plankton to its largest, the whale, along with the invaluable ecosystem services they provide.(n)

programme.title: Eco Eye - Healthy Environment
programme.desc: Dr Lara Dungan looks at some of the issues and concerns that affect our health and lifespan - including how and where we live to the air we breathe, the water we drink and even the packaging that our water comes in.(n)

programme.title: Atomic Age Declassified - Born With The Bomb
programme.desc: The bombing of Japan, the Soviet’s “First Lightning” test, and America’s H-bomb detonations were powerful signs that the Nuclear Age was upon us. But as recently declassified files reveal, explosive events were also carried out in secret.(n)

programme.title: Atomic Age Declassified - Spies In Space
programme.desc: While the world was captivated by NASA’s Apollo moon missions in the 1960s, the U.S. military was developing a parallel space program, an orbiting spy station that would gather high-res photographs of Soviet weapons systems.(n)

programme.title: Atomic Age Declassified - Filming The Bomb
programme.desc: The Cold War was a constant threat to the U.S. and Soviet Union throughout the second half of the 20th century. Learn how the U.S. military produced secret films with Hollywood, using its state-of-the-art studios, equipment, and even Marilyn Monroe.(n)

programme.title: Monster Trucks
programme.desc: After an accident at a nearby oil-drilling site displaces a strange and subterranean creature with a taste and a talent for speed, Tripp may have just found the key to getting out of town and a most unlikely friend.

programme.title: The Contractor
programme.desc: James Dial, once a top CIA assassin and now retired, is called back by the CIA to kill a terrorist leader in London But Dial learns that once his mission is accomplished, he will be next on the hit list, to remove any traces of American involvement.

programme.title: John Grisham's The Rainmaker
programme.desc: An idealistic young lawyer, taking on the case of an indigent family whose son is denied medical care by a powerful insurance company and dies, uncovers a multi-billion dollar insurance scam.

programme.title: The Hunger Games
programme.desc: Every district in the nation of Panem must send a boy and girl to fight to the death in the annual Hunger Games competition. Jennifer Lawrence is 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen, who volunteers to take her younger sister’s place in the games.

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: Military lawyer Lieutenant Daniel Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder. They contend they were acting under orders.

programme.title: Escape Plan
programme.desc: The world's foremost authority on structural security accepts a job to break out of an ultra-secret, high-tech facility. When he agrees, he is incarcerated in the most secret and secure prison on the planet—and no one knows it is just a test.

programme.title: John Grisham's The Rainmaker
programme.desc: An idealistic young lawyer, taking on the case of an indigent family whose son is denied medical care by a powerful insurance company and dies, uncovers a multi-billion dollar insurance scam.

programme.title: Child's Play 2
programme.desc: Chucky's back! Child's Play 2 continues where the chilling original left off, with Chucky's toy company rebuilding the original doll to prove that there was nothing wrong with it. Mistake.

programme.title: Meeting Evil
programme.desc: Follows disillusioned young family man John as a mysterious stranger, Richie takes him on a murder-fueled ride that transforms the weak-willed John into a desperate hero willing to go to any length to protect his family.

programme.title: The Contractor

programme.title: Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children
programme.desc: A soldier long thought dead in battle returns to wreak havoc on mankind as a punishment for the fact that he was genetically engineered by a corrupt company.

programme.title: Bad Country
programme.desc: A veteran Baton Rouge detective who infiltrates the most powerful criminal enterprise in the South and after taking down its top lieutenant and contract killer, convinces him to turn informant to help bring down the entire organization.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: Sequel to the blockbuster hit, the smart-talking Detroit cop shows the Beverly Hills force how to run business in an attempt to save his friend from an unjust dismissal.

programme.desc: Follows disillusioned young family man John as a mysterious stranger, Richie takes him on a murder-fueled ride that transforms the weak-willed John into a desperate hero willing to go to any length to protect his family.(n)

programme.title: The Other Guys
programme.desc: Detectives Christopher Danson and P.K. Highsmith are the most beloved cops in New York City. Two desks over and one back, sit Detectives Allen Gamble and Terry Hoitz. You've seen them in the background of photos, out of focus and eyes closed. They're not heroes – they're "the Other Guys.".(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: The Angels investigate a series of murders which occur after the theft of a witness protection profile database.(n)

programme.title: The Hunger Games
programme.desc: Every district in the nation of Panem must send a boy and girl to fight to the death in the annual Hunger Games competition. Jennifer Lawrence is 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen, who volunteers to take her younger sister’s place in the games.(n)

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.desc: American soldiers get a brutal education when a mission gone awry results in the U.S. military's single biggest firefight since Vietnam.(n)

programme.title: Direct Talk #008
programme.desc: Ahmad Joudeh, a dancer from a Syrian refugee camp, talks about his tumultuous life and the activities he has been working on to keep the Syrian conflict fresh in people's minds 12 years on.

programme.title: KABUKI KOOL
programme.desc: Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores the folklore and history behind Japanese oni, or demons, and guides us through three spectacular kabuki dramas in which they play a central role.

programme.desc: Animals Unleashed is a user-generated content show that features the most unpredictable and hilarious animal clips from around the world. From the wild to the living room, each episode showcases animals at their most surprising, mischievous and outrageous! Each action-packed episode features the very best animal clips available packaged into related segments, features, or even games, all with highly-entertaining narration.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: In order to win the title, the people of Britain showcase their talent ranging from mundane to the most extraordinary acts that are seemingly impossible. Season 15 returns with Judges Actress Amanda Holden, singer Alesha Dixon, comedian David Walliams and show creator Simon Cowell, together with Hosts Ant and Dec.

programme.title: Secret Safari
programme.desc: A new kind of natural history series. With 360 degree access, this show follows the rangers, guides and vets at Oi Pejeta, Kenya - the premier safari park in Africa. This is what it really takes to keep the wild ALIVE.

programme.title: Weather Gone Viral
programme.desc: The episodes cover the most extreme weather action caught on camera. We learn from survivors who have beaten the odds to overcome the most treacherous weather conditions imaginable. The series also shows how for on-air meteorologists, being on the front lines of Mother Nature is never easy and sometimes the reporter covering the story becomes the story.

programme.title: Films & Stars
programme.desc: Films and Stars cover the hottest events from the big screen every week.

programme.title: Beat The Chasers
programme.desc: Could you beat the greatest quiz team ever assembled? Bringing together all five of our favourite quiz geniuses, Beat the Chasers, hosted by Bradley Walsh, expands the award-winning The Chase brand for a primetime audience.

programme.title: Sunshine Station
programme.desc: Jimmy and Jenny run a very special bus station - the Sunshine Station! It isn't just a place you go to get to a destination. It is a destination in itself - a destination of endless fun, songs, dances, discovery and wonders! At the Sunshine Station, pre-schoolers embark on a learning journey to discover the world around them by going to various interesting locations around Singapore.

programme.title: Bugsville
programme.desc: Bugsville is an entertaining and educational pre-school programme featuring NATALIE, her parents (Mary and Fred) and her friends. The show will feature live action filmed in home sets as well as composited CGI shot in a green screen studio.

programme.title: Kit n Kate
programme.desc: Two small kitties named Kit and Kate love their toy box. As soon as they hop inside, magic starts to happen. Kid's imagination transforms their room into a blueberry island, race track or a medieval castle. Every time the kitties create a whole new world with amazing discoveries, surprises and not-so-easy-to-solve dilemmas.

programme.title: The Fixies
programme.desc: The Fixies follows the comical misadventures of Tom Thomas and his secret friendship with Simka and Nolik, the children of the Fixie family that lives in his apartment. There's just no end to the troubles Tom Thomas and his Fixie friends get themselves into with all the gadgets and appliances around them! Luckily for Tom Thomas, the Fixies have the smarts, skills, and tools they need to figure out a problem and solve it before his parents find out.

programme.title: Bugsville
programme.desc: Bugsville is an entertaining and educational pre-school programme featuring NATALIE, her parents (Mary and Fred) and her friends. The show will feature live action filmed in home sets as well as composited CGI shot in a green screen studio.

programme.title: Tayo The Little Bus
programme.desc: The adventures of Tayo, a blue bus with the number 120. He is very playful and mischievous with his passengers and his friends.

programme.title: Tayo The Little Bus
programme.desc: The adventures of Tayo, a blue bus with the number 120. He is very playful and mischievous with his passengers and his friends.

programme.title: Pinkfong Songs & Stories
programme.desc: Enjoy the best of Pinkfong's most loved songs and stories with all your favourite characters!

programme.title: The Enchanted Village Of Pinocchio
programme.desc: THE ENCHANTED VILLAGE OF PINOCCHIO is a fun and positive adaptation of Carlo Collodi's masterpiece. It's a series for the entire family, both moving and funny, where the world of childhood meets the world of fairy tales.

programme.title: Dogmatix And The Indomitables
programme.desc: Dogmatix leads a gang of animal friends, the Indomitables, living in Lutetia (Paris in the Ancient World), who have to battle it out with the Romans (who insist on imposing their way of life on the Gaulish people). With its fast-paced high jinks, high-speed chases and a touch of magic, Dogmatix and the Indomitables will provide great fun and adventures for all!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Blue and small, standing only three apples high, the Smurfs might be hard to tell apart at first. However, each Smurf is a distinct individual with his or her own personality, their names say it all!

programme.title: What On Earth
programme.desc: On returning to school, Leonardo decides to run against queen bee Weiling for Class Captain - with Zachary as his campaign manager. Weiling has a big head-start, so Zachary gets to work. Meanwhile Raffles and Neela take on setting up the caf - by trying to operate the cantankerous coffee machine.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Luggy
programme.desc: Despite DJ Blaze's efforts to halt the Compactor from crushing Luggy to bits, their peace was only temporary. With the help of his newfound friend BONNIE, DJ Blaze scrambles to save Luggy. They find a way back home to Zachary, but mysterious smoke rises out of the blue just as they are about to leave NERD. At the park, Zippy struggles to care for Pee Wee despite Mdm Woofalot's nudges. A helpless Zachary tries his best to comfort a distressed Pee Wee.

programme.title: Alvinnn!!! And The Chipmunks
programme.desc: Join single parent, David Seville, for more trials and tribulations of trying to raise six hyper-active Chipmunks! Like most parents, Dave's patience will be pushed to the limit, forcing him to end most sentences in "ALVINNN!!!"As the Chipmunks celebrate their 60th Anniversary and their historic star on the Walk of Fame, they begin their fourth season of this exceptional CGI series created and directed by Janice Karman.

programme.title: Oddbods
programme.desc: The unique and quirky gang of Fuse, Newt, Pogo, Bubbles, Jeff, Zee and Slick laugh, trick and trip their way through life.

programme.title: Giganto Club SG
programme.desc: It is raining outside the clubhouse so Howie comes up with the perfect indoor distraction - parlour games but with a Giganto Club twist!

programme.title: iYO
programme.desc: After celebrating Mei's birthday with the family, iYO seeks to find out the day he was born so that he may have a special day each year to celebrate as well.

programme.title: Miraculous World: Shanghai - The Legend Of Ladydragon
programme.desc: During school break, Marinette decides to travel to Shanghai to meet Adrien and discover her own origins.

programme.title: Magic Adventures: The Crystal Of Dark
programme.desc: A young princess Olivia is transported to many wondrous lands and along the way she teams up with allies. Together they embark on a dangerous quest to find 4 great wizards and 7 magic crystals that will help her stop the Dark wizard and save her parents, and they learn that real magic is having good virtues of courage, friendship, and cooperation.

programme.title: Moominvalley &
programme.desc: Inspired by Mrs Fillyjonk, Moominpappa hunts for a job, hoping to set a better example for his son. But Moominpappa's daily absence starts to affect the whole Moomin family and what exactly is he doing when he is away?

programme.title: The Tales Of Alex & Weero
programme.desc: Join Alex and the cute animated creature Weero in their time travelling escapades through history.

programme.title: Asia Unplated With Diana Chan
programme.desc: Chinese cuisine is flavourful and diverse. Diana shows how easy it is to make a Yum Cha favourite at home as she prepares Sesame Balls with Red Bean Paste Filling.' Master Chef alumni and friend, Karlie Verkerk, shares her recipe for Three Cup Chicken- San Bei Ji'- a simple, homestyle Chinese dish. Jacob Leung (cook and author) also joins Diana in the kitchen to prepare a citrusy and aromatic dish Soy, Orange & Chinese Five-Spice Braised Duck'.

programme.title: Our World To Change
programme.desc: At NTU, scientists are working on innovative sustainable energy solutions. Its researchers are also making discoveries about the air microbiome that will have a major impact on human health.

programme.title: Anyone Can Sing
programme.desc: Six ordinary people who cannot sing are given six weeks to learn how to sing opera with the help of voice coaches.

programme.desc: AllTime Greatest Clip Show features the very best online content from creators around the world. Grouped around easy to follow themes and segments, the series covers a wide variety of clips from DIY stunts with epic fails, to polished professionals and their mind blowing achievements.

programme.title: News Tonight
programme.desc: The daily evening-news programme featuring highlights and coverage of both local and international news with a local perspective.

programme.title: MasterChef Singapore
programme.desc: A massive advantage is up for grabs to the best performer across today's two challenges. The best cooks battle against one of Signapore's rising star chefs for a massive advanatage - the Power Pin! Whoever comes out on top wil have a turbo-charged run to the finale.

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Finding somewhere to keep safe is one of the biggest challenges an animal faces. But some animals don't have to find a safe place - they build one. In this episode, Chris reveals some of the best building animals in the world - a group that is incredibly varied. Accomplished animal architects include everything from beavers to bees and prairie dogs to bowerbirds. They don't only build homes, however - they also make structures to raise their young, store food, catch prey and impress mates.

programme.title: Chris Humfrey's Animal Instinct
programme.desc: Chris hits the road to Potoroo Palace in New South Wales, to meet Priscilla, the newest member of his animal family. Along the way, he belts out some of his infamous animal tunes, and stops at a secret location, which is like a scene out of Jurassic Park. Chris comes face to face with a rare albino echidna, a 97-year old Sulphur Crested Cockatoo, and two Tiger Quolls who happen to be named after himself - Christina and Humfrey!

programme.title: It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia Yr 16
programme.desc: The Gang's going to be on Bar Rescue but a series of bad omens leads them to believe they are all cursed. They set off to undo the curses and make amends to the people/things they've wronged.

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond The Lobby
programme.desc: In this Christmas special, Giles and Monica travel to Kulm Hotel, St Moritz. This Swiss Alpine hotel was the birthplace of winter tourism more than 150 years ago. The Kulm's owner, Johannes Badrutt, made a bet with summer guests that if they returned in the winter and didn't enjoy themselves he would pay for their stay. The guests stayed for the season - and a new industry of winter leisure and sports was born.

programme.title: The Incredible Hidden Gems
programme.desc: (R) In the third season, the host will take you to explore the beautiful secrets, take stock of the country landscapes that you can't miss in your life, travel around the beautiful scenery of different places, and feel the wonder of the earth's creation. Let us follow Marco Liao to the end of the world, and feel the scenery of the world heritage.

programme.title: Life Extraordinaire
programme.desc: (R) 10 years of jail time left a huge void in Pottery artist Kim Whye Kees life, but gave him profound understanding of the plights of troubled youths. Bjorn Low gave up his career in advertising 5 years ago to become an urban farmer, promoting sustainable farming and the green movement.

programme.title: Gracious Revenge
programme.desc: (R)(Dual Language - Mandarin and Korean) Three years ago, Youzhen and Ju Haijun had a brief relationship. Youzhen begins working at Haijun's company. Haijun believes that Youzhen was his girlfriend three years ago, but Youzhen denies it.

programme.title: Love Destiny
programme.desc: (Dual Language - Mandarin and Thai) Det's father can tell that his son cares about Ketsurang. He promises to pick an auspicious date for their engagement as soon as possible.

programme.title: Homemade Love Story
programme.desc: (Dual Language - Mandarin and Korean) Zhenghou notices that Minzai is enjoying a walk with Sun Zhenghou and concludes that the two have a liking towards each other. He intends to let Minzai go so that she can start a new life.

programme.title: Homemade Love Story
programme.desc: (Dual Language - Mandarin and Korean) The new employee, Jin Enzhi, turns out to be Xueshi's old friend. Enzhi gives Xueshi a warm hug when she recognises him. Observing the close interaction between Xueshi and Enzhi, Manqing feels uncomfortable about it.

programme.title: Two Worlds Apart
programme.desc: Although the French advocates "Liberty, Equality, Fraternity", here lives the Romani people who have been ostracized for generations. Living in fenced illegal clusters next to the railway, they keep to themselves. Is deep-seated discrimination keeping them from integrating into the French society?

programme.title: Again My Life
programme.desc: (Dual Language - Mandarin and Korean) The acquisition of JQ Construction becomes crucial, and Pu Dahao has no choice but to find another way.

programme.desc: A comprehensive half-hour news programme, NEWS TONIGHT provides viewers with important local, international and financial developments for the day.
